reviews.title: Google Play Services has Stopped
body: Every time I open this app  my Note 4 heats up and lags until I get a message saying Google play services has crashed.
Beyond that  I use this app to take handwritten notes  but the UI is terrible.

There's no simple way to center the canvas on screen  the arrows continually get in the way  and the zooming/scrolling never seems to work on the first try  preferring to detect only one finger and leave a giant streak in the note. Last of all  please stop pushing Evernote ads into my device's notification menu.

reviews.author: Peter Stindl
reviews.title: Missing VERY BASIC features!!! And a big negative surprise!
body: You can move notes to notebooks so that you don't lose the overview.
BUT YOU HAVE TO MOVE NOTE BY NOTE.
NO WAY TO MARK SEVERAL NOTES.
I googled a lot to find something because I could not believe it.
But there's nothing.
Unusable for me.
There's NO WAY to select more than 1 note for moving or deleting or whatever.
Now to the big negative surprise.
I searched long for articles on the Internet and transferred them to Evernote.
Worked like always without special message but when I look later in Evernote none of the articles was clipped due to clipping errors.
This is very bad if you don't get an error message or only when you check the notes in Evernote.

reviews.title: Missing the Mark

The better features of Evernote aren't worth the pricing  in my opinion  especially steps.
I lock my apps with an app locker  so "paying for a pin lock" is silly.
Other features are more fluff than serious needs.
$50/yr is a big No  Thank You.
If Evernote was two flavors - Free and $25/yr Tops - it would be worth it.

I had to do a factory reset so I re-downloaded Evernote after the reset and signed in  but there was no saved data or notes.
So I contact the Evernote people and they said I should never uninstall Evernote without first contacting them?
. So they said download the desktop version and go to history and select the version I uninstalled  So I did to find out the history was greyed out  so after several emails I gave up.

Second  there is no dark theme for this app  making it impossible to write at night.
White background shines at night like the sun.

reviews.author: Paul Reeves Bruening
body: Erased notes with no backup - they and the time spent writing them simply disapeared.
We lost critical data implementing Evernote into our processes.

In our experience  the software was so seriously flawed that the projects we launched with it became jeopardized...but  ultimately it was too late because we had implemented it across 42 individuals of different skill levels and did not have time or resources to retrain them and move to a new platform.

In the end  we lost critical data on multiple occasions and NO ONE at Evernote was able to help (or even seemed to grasp the severity of the situation) despite epic wait times and extensive conversations with nice but helpless tech (sp) support.
At the risk of sounding redundant  we won't be using this for any business related projects in the future.
This product is OK for saving shopping lists  but I wouldn't call it business ready.

So as I begin classes I found that I was transcribing notes from notebook to Google keep to Word document on my work desk.
The were almost never accurate in translation!
I found that for Academic Purposes it was easier for me to try something like Evernote.
I created Evernote notebook for each of my classes.
I would go on to do the same for work and freelancing.

reviews.title: Too much functionality
body: No other product in this category offers as much functionality as evernote.
I don't use a fraction of the features offered even in the fee version.
The constant prompts to upgrade are irritating but at least there are no adds telling me my device is infected.
The UI is not attractive.
Its better on the windows desktop client than the web.
I like the idea of notebooks and notes within notebooks although sometimes I'd like notes in multiple notebooks.
Id like to be able to nest my notebooks in something more useful than notebook groups.
I like the multi level approach of one note but it doesn't work well on handheld devices.

reviews.author: Michael Smith
reviews.title: Update...
body: For the record  I would have most likely never even tried Evernote and written it off as one of those apps that was part of the bloatware that came as part of the undeleteable (that could be a word) apps that are all a part of getting a non Google tablet.
My first Android tablet was the Nexus 7  and I found what worked for me then  and being a creature of habit  I have a tendacy to stich with what I know.

Upon purchasing my Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5  Evernote was an included application  and in checking out what it was and did  I figured it was worth a try  and the fact Samsung included a year Premium service (the first taste is always free)
I figured what's to loose.
I'm glad I did.
Evernote has become one of my daily use apps.
As a student money is always tight  but even if I can't afford to pay a year at a time  I will continue my premium service.
Kudos to all involved!

reviews.author: Jessica Harvey
reviews.title: 4.7 stars, fix handwriting and it's a 5!
body: 4.7 stars  fix handwriting and it's a 5! My son and I both struggle every minute with SEVERE ADHD. On top of that I have severe anxiety disorder which is usually triggered by my inability to get and/or stay organized.
With Evernote  I'm able to create notebooks fir everything  and do SO many things to help me at least remember the most important things.
The yearly subscription cost seemed a bit much at first  but it was worth it once I finally decided to buy it.
One suggestion would be to improve upon your handwriting option.
I LOVE the ability to write directly on my phone/tablet  but the options for ink pen style/color/smoothness are severely lacking.
Fix that  and this will be the SINGLE GREATEST app for those of us with organizational/memory disabilities.

reviews.author: Dwight Coutts
reviews.title: Evernote - Changing for the better?
body: Its not a simple app any longer  very feature rich.
You have to have an evernote account now!
I don't want to sync my notes or store them in 'the cloud'!
There have been to many times I haven't been able to access my notes because I'm not connected to ' the cloud'.
The app persistently tells me I need to verify my email.
There are few apps I've used on a daily basis  Evernote is one of them.
But know it seems unless you have a premium account it's getting more difficult to use.
Time to move on?

reviews.title: Great app, but a few niggles
body: Great app  but a few niggles A great way of organising and keeping all those notes of things you can't remember.

Great synchronisation across Android and Windows devices  BUT if you're offline the full set of notes isn't accessible with the free version - should have the option store them locally on each device like Dropbox.

Also no vertical scroll bar to access different notes quickly (shouldn't be much of a challenge to the developers!) and the prompts to upgrade from the free version are far too frequent - stop pestering me!

reviews.author: Lauren Hansbury
body: I adore Evernote  as well as the extensions like Clearly.
Never have any issues clipping/saving content  syncing across all my devices works like a breeze.
This is the only productivity/planning app that I trust to organize my ideas  important work docs  and it's easy formatting is great for short-form writing drafts and note -taking in particular.
There are also fantastic features for collaboration for business & creative projects  and you can instantly feature content that you've saved and share it through a Slideshow function.

This is a great tool for students  teachers  project-based professionals  and anyone who has to produce or present materials because of the auto-formatting and syncing allows for little interruption during the creative process (no stopping to fix format issues/inserting images and videos to the text content is as easy as copy/paste) and the final product can be viewed via slideshow/collab tools straight from the app itself  so there's never a worry about compatibility across platforms messing up the formatting or integrity of the content.
It leaves sharing across MS Office Online  Google Docs  etc in the dust.

reviews.author: A Google User
body: I gave five stars for years  until the latest update blows up my phone with Android.process.acore error  and trying to use Evernote through a browser forces either Ant Man sized desktop version or forced installation of the offending app.
I would be content to use the browser.
I am well aware fixes that have worked for some users  but those haven't worked for me since the latest update.
Evernote is not the only app that generates this error: Facebook  Dropbox and maybe a couple of others.
The error makes my phone completely useless when they are installed.
Lollipop 5.1 will supposedly deal with the issue  but won't come to my phone for months.

But here's the thing: I don't use Evernote for communicating with contacts or for scheduling  so I would love to be able to turn off to deal with the probable cause of the error and just use Evernote for what I use it for.
Supposedly Android M may have something like this.
Loved Evernote  but this could force me to migrate to another less invasive app  one that lacks the social and calendar functionalities Evernote has started pushing lately  which crash my phone.

I've barely even scratched the surface of what Evernote offers.
Sometimes I don't even open this app for months on end.
That's just it  though.
For me  the need to jot down a note comes sporadically  but when it happens  I'm frantically trying to put down an idea before I forget it.
It's for that reason that this has become a beloved app.
When I need it  it's a quick  efficient  and effective way of getting a note down.

reviews.author: Jeremy Olson
reviews.title: Great! Missing some key things, though.
body: Great!
Missing some key things  though.
I love evernote!
I use it every day for classes.
However  using it has caused some key exclusions to become evident.
First  the ability to search hand written notes.
I have a tablet with a stylus  so sometimes I like to scratch out notes directly into the app.
Please allow the ability to search the electronically handwritten notes!
Secondly  I sometimes use a bluetooth keyboard to type out my notes. Please allow the ability to "tab"  that way I can structure and organize my notes exactly to how I like.
Thanks!

reviews.title: One of my top 5 apps/programs, both on portable devices & PC's.
body: One of my top 5 apps/programs  both on portable devices & PC's.
I have been using this app for many years - even before smartphones really existed  I was using it on PC's.
Probably the most useful feature for me then and still even currently to some degree is the Web Clipper extension for Google Chrome.
I pay for the premium Evernote plan  and for me it's worth every penny because not only do I get way more storage  I get a whole bunch of special features with Evernote Premium.
I also really like how Evernote is able to work with many other productivity apps like Neat¬©.

reviews.author: Filippo Salustri
reviews.title: Nearly perfect
body: Excellent lightweight  general note taking app.
Don't expect it to do everything  but expect it to do most things  and do them well.
The UI is a little clumsy still (e.g.  the use of stacks) but there is steady progress.
Capabilities between mobile and desktop versions vary too much.
Some formatting bugs exist between desktop and mobile.
The other thing I wish was better is copying and pasting from Evernote to other apps  which is often imperfect.
Also  I think they need to switch to support a wider subset of HTML5 for note content.

reviews.author: Shouin Nelson
reviews.title: Still room for improvement.
body: The ubiquitous Evernote.
While a popular and effective app  Evernote can improve.
It needs a better inking system  one that can recognize pressure sensitivity in strokes.
A better handwriting mode in general.
More colours  more paper styles  more pens.
It definitely needs a night mode  some of us have light sensitive eyes.
At the end of the day  most if what it does it does well enough  it's popular  and we'll integrated into many other application environments.
Can't ignore it.

reviews.author: Ryan Spears
reviews.title: No Competition But Still Needs Problems Addressed
body: Four major gripes: (1) Numbered lists are not compatible with check lists.
(2) Tags cannot be placed within tags.
(3) Strikethrough not available in text editor.
(4) No text formatting available  such as color or size.
These features are extremely important and used daily in the desktop version.
Would like to see some consistency.
Previously  tags could not be deleted  but this has since been fixed.
Evernote is a life saver  and there is literally no other option that comes close to getting the job done.

reviews.author: Gregory Opera
reviews.title: Neat idea, but let-down by no Linux support.
body: Neat idea  but let-down by no Linux support.

An application like Evernote is only as useful as the service behind it  and the service behind a concept like Evernote is only as useful as the availability of an application or program to connect to said service...
Which is where Evernote fails - it is not natively available for Linux-based operating systems (such as Ubuntu).
Sure  the Android application works well enough - but when the only way to access Evernote under a Linux-based operating system is via a Web browser  it quickly looses its appeal.

body: I have been a user of evernote for a few years now and it is a very useful way of storing info.
But be careful it is limited to the storage space you have in your device if you want all your notes to be available for offline use.
NO data is saved to the real sdcard and despite asking for this feature for about 2 years now I have needed to delete 125 notes just so I can have all my info available for offline browsing.
Moved some of it to other note storage apps.
So beware evernote is very slow to implement.
